newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso ends softer on month-end dlr demand.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso ends softer on month-end dlr demand.

text.p: Mexican peso contracts reversed early firmness on corporate demand to meet month-end obligations in dollars, dealers said.
"Many domestic and international investors decided to cover (dollar) shorts prior to the end of the month," a dealer said.
"The market is still short on dollars and the peso could open under pressure tommorrow for that reason," he added.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour stablemate both ended 1.2 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.7990/7.8010 and 7.7960/7.8000 per dollar.
Same-day peso contracts closed trade for the day earlier 1.1 centavos weaker at 7.7730/7.7760 per dollar.
